objects.definition: The degree of closeness of a measurement of a quantity to that quantity's true value.
objects.name: Accuracy

objects.definition: The minimum concentration of a substance that can be distinguished from the absence of that substance within a stated confidence limit (generally 1%) given a particular analytical method.
objects.name: Method detection limit

objects.definition: This describes a numeric value below which measured values should be considered suspect. This numeric value should be empirically derived.
objects.name: Physical limit lower bound

objects.definition: This describes a numeric value above which measured values should be considered suspect. This numeric value should be empirically derived.
objects.name: Physical limit upper bound

objects.definition: The degree to which repeated measurements under unchanged conditions show the same results.
objects.name: Precision

objects.definition: The smallest concentration of analyte that can be reported by laboratory.
objects.name: Reporting level
